description: From Middle English *unveilen (suggested by past participle unveiled, vnueylyd (“unveiled”)). Equivalent to un- +‎ veil.

verbs.description: unveil (third-person singular simple present unveils, present participle unveiling, simple past and past participle unveiled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove a veil from; to uncover; to reveal something hidden.
examples: Synonyms: expose, uncloak; see also Thesaurus:reveal

entries.meaning: (transitive) to show, especially for the first time
examples: The car company are going to unveil the new sports car model next month.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To remove a veil; to reveal oneself.
